de.tudarmstadt.ukp.lmf.api

Class UbyQuickAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tudarmstadt.ukp.lmf.api.Uby
      • de.tudarmstadt.ukp.lmf.api.UbyQuickAPI

  • public class UbyQuickAPI
extends Uby
    This class represents an extension of the Uby class and offers additional methods for quick searching of different UBY-LMF elements in a database containing a LexicalResource.

    For performance reasons, the methods offered by this class do not return fully initialized Uby-LMF class instances.

    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Silvana Hartmann, Zijad Maksuti

public UbyQuickAPI()
        Deprecated. use UbyQuickAPI(DBConfig) instead
        Using this constructor, you have to call setDbConfig before using any method.

      • UbyQuickAPI

        public UbyQuickAPI(DBConfig config)
            throws UbyInvalidArgumentException
        Constructor for a UbyQuickAPI instance used for searching of different elements in a database containing UBY-LMF LexicalResource. The connection to the database is specified using a DBConfig instance.
        Parameters:
        dbConfig - configuration of the database containing UBY-LMF lexical resource.
        Throws:
        UbyInvalidArgumentException - if the specified dbConfig is null
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • lightLexicons

        public java.util.List<Lexicon> lightLexicons()
        This method fetches a List of light Lexicon instances containing only the name and the id.

        The method is meant for fast fetching of lexicons. In order to get complete Lexicon instances use Uby.getLexicons() instead.

        Returns:
        a list of all lexicons contained in the database. The returned lexicons are light and consist only of an id and a name. If the accessed database does not contain any lexicons, this method returns an empty list.
        Since:
        0.2.0
        See Also:
        Lexicon.getName(), Lexicon.getId()

      • alignedSenseIDs

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> alignedSenseIDs(Sense sense)
        This method fetches a List of all identifiers of Sense instances which are aligned by a SenseAxis with the specified sense.

        The method is meant for fast fetching of alignments. For retrieving of complete alignments use Uby.getSenseAxisBySense(Sense) instead.

        Parameters:
        sense - all returned identifiers must belong to senses which are aligned to it
        Returns:
        a list of identifiers of all senses which are aligned with the specified sense by a sense axis.
        If the specified sense is not contained in any alignment or the specified sense is null, this method returns an empty list.
        Since:
        0.2.0

      • alignedSenseIDs

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> alignedSenseIDs(java.lang.String id)
        This method fetches a List of all identifiers of Sense instances which are aligned by a SenseAxis with the sense specified by its identifier.

        The method is meant for fast fetching of alignments. For retrieving of complete alignments use Uby.getSenseAxisBySense(Sense) instead.

        Parameters:
        id - all returned identifiers must belong to senses which are aligned to the sense represented by the id
        Returns:
        a list of identifiers of all senses which are aligned with the specified sense by a sense axis.
        If the sense specified by its identifier is not contained in any alignment or the specified id is null, this method returns an empty list.
        Since:
        0.2.0

      • lightSenseAxes

        public java.util.List<SenseAxis> lightSenseAxes(java.util.List<Sense> listSense)
        Consumes a List of Sense instances and returns a List of all SenseAxis instances aligning senses from the consumed list. In particular, every returned sense axis aligns two senses from the consumed list.
        The returned sense axes are not fully initialized and contain only references to senses which they bind.
        Parameters:
        listSense - A list of senses for which the sense alignments should be returned.
        Note that sense instances contained in the list must not be fully initialized. It sufficient to provide a list of senses where each sense only has its unique identifier set.
        Returns:
        a list of sense alignments available from the input list.

        If no sense alignments are available, this method returns an empty list.

        Since:
        0.2.0
        See Also:
        lightSenseAxesBySenseIDs(List)

      • lightSenseAxesBySenseIDs

        public java.util.List<SenseAxis> lightSenseAxesBySenseIDs(java.util.List<java.lang.String> listSenseId)
        Consumes a List of unique identifiers of Sense instances and returns a List of all SenseAxis instances aligning senses which identifiers are in the consumed list. In particular, every returned sense axis aligns two senses which unique identifiers are in the consumed list.
        The returned sense axes are not fully initialized and contain only references to senses which they bind.
        Parameters:
        listSenseId - A list of sense identifiers for which the sense alignments should be returned.
        Returns:
        a list of sense alignments available from the input list.

        If no sense alignments are available, this method returns an empty list.

        Since:
        0.2.0
        See Also:
        Uby.getSensesAxis(List), lightSenseAxes(List)
